intro: Acrolasia gracilenta, commonly known as the slender acrolasia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. Acrolasia gracilenta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
